com.example.mapnector.FirebaseCommunication

Class FirebaseMailSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.mapnector.FirebaseCommunication.FirebaseMailSystem

  • public class FirebaseMailSystem
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains logic of doing actions associated with mails and the firebase; One of the 3 FirebaseCommunication classes - manages work that has to do with the mail system

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  FirebaseMailSystem.MAIL_TYPE
      types of mails that the app will create by itself without involving the user

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private AdapterManager ADmanager
      ref to ADmanager created in LVhelper
      private android.widget.EditText edtTitleSendMailRef
      reference to title of dialog to send custom mail in UserOptionsSystem.class; in order to allow send some mails without need the need of the user
      private com.google.firebase.database.GenericTypeIndicator<java.util.List<Mail>> genericTypeIndicator 
      private android.app.AlertDialog.Builder groupJoinRequestDialogBuilder
      dialog to decide whether to accept or reject requests to join some group
      private com.google.firebase.database.ValueEventListener mailListener
      listener to mine mail-box; run code when change in mails array occured
      private java.util.ArrayList<Mail> mailsToRemove
      arrayList of mails that should be removed(why array? suppose i want to remove one mail, second, mail, delete third...
      private com.google.firebase.database.DatabaseReference refMineMails
      ref to current user's mailbox in firebase
      private Mail selectedRequestMail
      the request to join group selected before opening dialog

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FirebaseMailSystem(AdapterManager ADmanager, UIHelper uiHelper, android.app.Activity activity, android.widget.EditText edTitle)
      a very long constructor(about 200 rows); at beginning initializes variables, then adds a lot of listeners; the main one's are that if we click on custom mail, we can write a reply mail to the sender; if we long-click on some mail - the mail is removed from the mail list(deleted); and also adds simple mail listeners to updates in the firebase

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Mail createMail(FirebaseMailSystem.MAIL_TYPE type)
      create's mail without involving the user in the process
      void DB_sendMail(Mail mail)
      One of the 3 functions to send mail; here we send one mail to all groupUsers of some group; used often by leaders who want to send one mail to all group members(without the leader himself of course)
      void DB_sendMail(java.lang.String guUid, FirebaseMailSystem.MAIL_TYPE type)
      one of 3 functions to send mails to some user in firebase; this one is used often by mails that aren't involving the user
      void DB_sendMail(java.lang.String guUid, Mail mail)
      One of the 3 functions to send mail; send mail to a specific groupUser; the mail created via CreateGroupSystem;
      void disableMailListener() 

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        private final com.google.firebase.database.ValueEventListener mailListener

      • genericTypeIndicator

        private final com.google.firebase.database.GenericTypeIndicator<java.util.List<Mail>> genericTypeIndicator

      • mailsToRemove

        private final java.util.ArrayList<Mail> mailsToRemove
        arrayList of mails that should be removed(why array? suppose i want to remove one mail, second, mail, delete third... but i have no internet; this way all teh things i asked to remove will be removed when the connection gets back

      • groupJoinRequestDialogBuilder

        private final android.app.AlertDialog.Builder groupJoinRequestDialogBuilder
        dialog to decide whether to accept or reject requests to join some group

      • selectedRequestMail

        private Mail selectedRequestMail
        the request to join group selected before opening dialog

        reference to title of dialog to send custom mail in UserOptionsSystem.class; in order to allow send some mails without need the need of the user

    • Constructor Detail

      • FirebaseMailSystem

        public FirebaseMailSystem(AdapterManager ADmanager,
                          UIHelper uiHelper,
                          android.app.Activity activity,
                          android.widget.EditText edTitle)
        a very long constructor(about 200 rows); at beginning initializes variables, then adds a lot of listeners; the main one's are that if we click on custom mail, we can write a reply mail to the sender; if we long-click on some mail - the mail is removed from the mail list(deleted); and also adds simple mail listeners to updates in the firebase
        Parameters:
        ADmanager - ref to ADmanager created in LVHelper
        uiHelper - ref to uiHelper created in MapsActivity
        activity - MapsActivity
        edTitle - edtTitle in dialog to create custom mail UserOptionsSystem.class

    • Method Detail

      • createMail

        public Mail createMail(FirebaseMailSystem.MAIL_TYPE type)
        create's mail without involving the user in the process
        Parameters:
        type - the type of the mail to create
        Returns:
        the created mail

      • DB_sendMail

        public void DB_sendMail(java.lang.String guUid,
                        FirebaseMailSystem.MAIL_TYPE type)
        one of 3 functions to send mails to some user in firebase; this one is used often by mails that aren't involving the user
        Parameters:
        guUid - the groupUser to send mail to
        type - the type of the mail that should be created by app automatically

      • DB_sendMail

        public void DB_sendMail(Mail mail)
        One of the 3 functions to send mail; here we send one mail to all groupUsers of some group; used often by leaders who want to send one mail to all group members(without the leader himself of course)
        Parameters:
        mail - the mail to send - created by CreateGroupSystem

      • disableMailListener

        public void disableMailListener()

      • DB_sendMail

        public void DB_sendMail(java.lang.String guUid,
                        Mail mail)
        One of the 3 functions to send mail; send mail to a specific groupUser; the mail created via CreateGroupSystem;
        Parameters:
        guUid - the groupUser uid to send the mail
        mail - the mail to send - created by CreateGroupSystem
